channel.title: Help with silabs client
channel.description:
when i runt he but it says
C:\Documents and Settings\Compaq_Owner\Desktop\client>JAVA -Xmx500m -jar client .jar 0 0 highmem members 0 'JAVA' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file.
C:\Documents and Settings\Compaq_Owner\Desktop\client>pause Press any key to continue . . .
helps plz

item.title: Help with silabs client

omg worked TY SO MUCh!

Read full topic

item.title: Help with silabs client
item.dc:creator: @Fr33b1e Fr33b1e
item.description:
@Fr33b1e wrote:

OK, I guess I can. First, make sure you have JDK 6u2 downloaded, or fix everything up in what I’m about to post.

To get to your Environmental Variables, follow this:
Start Menu->Control Panel->Performance and Maintenance->System->Advanced->Environmental Variables

At the very top, make one named PATH, and in it put:

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_02\bin Change 1.6.0_02 to 1.6.0 for JDK 6…

Now, add ANOTHER variable and name it ;%CLASSPATH% and in it put:

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_02\bin;%CLASSPATH% Change 1.6.0_02 to 1.6.0 for JDK 6
You have that part done.

Now, go to the box that’s under it, and find another variable named PATH, and in it, replace it with, or if you can’t find it, add one in, and put this in it:

%SystemRoot%\system32;%SystemRoot%;%SystemRoot%\sy stem32\WBEM;C:\Program Files\Intel\DMIX;C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_02\bin Change 1.6.0_02 to 1.6.0 for JDK 6

Read full topic

item.title: Help with silabs client
item.dc:creator: @soldja soldja
item.description:
@soldja wrote:

can u show em how i can fix this plz?

item.title: Help with silabs client
item.dc:creator: @Fr33b1e Fr33b1e
item.description:
@Fr33b1e wrote:

I’m guessing you’re missing the PATH variable in your System Variables (environmental), or your CLASSPATH is wrong. I had the same problem, fixed both of them, and now it works.

Read full topic
